alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 5:23PM MDT until June 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the southeast side of Albuquerque. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albuquerque, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, North Valley, Sandia Heights, South Valley, Alameda and Carnuel. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 216 and 235. Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 157 and 168. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
